revised_title: Differential Action of X-Rays on Animal Tissues
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effect of X-rays of different wavelengths on animal tissues, specifically normal rat skin and Jensen's Rat Sarcoma. They found that X-rays with varying wavelengths had different effects on the tissues, providing evidence for a differential action. This research has implications for understanding the potential use of X-rays in treating tumors and diseases.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology and Histology
